intro: Medinilla floribunda, commonly known as the pink medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and prefers partial shade. Medinilla floribunda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
